TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract IServicedComponentInfo

Docs.summary: Implemented by the class to obtain information about the component via the method.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.IServicedComponentInfo> interface does not need to be implemented directly in your code. It is used internally by the .NET Framework infrastructure.
The <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.IServicedComponentInfo.GetComponentInfo%2A> method does not appear in the <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.ServicedComponent> class interface. Instead, <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.ServicedComponent> explicitly implements <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.IServicedComponentInfo>.

MemberSignature.Value: public void GetComponentInfo (ref int infoMask, out string[] infoArray);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void GetComponentInfo(int32& infoMask, [out] string[]& infoArray) cil managed
Public Sub GetComponentInfo (ByRef infoMask As Integer, ByRef infoArray As String())
public: void GetComponentInfo(int % infoMask, [Runtime::InteropServices::Out] cli::array <System::String ^> ^ % infoArray);

Docs.param: A bitmask where 0x00000001 is a key for the serviced component's process ID, 0x00000002 is a key for the application domain ID, and 0x00000004 is a key for the serviced component's remote URI.
A string array that may contain any or all of the following, in order: the serviced component's process ID, the application domain ID, and the serviced component's remote URI.
Docs.summary: Obtains certain information about the class instance.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.IServicedComponentInfo.GetComponentInfo%2A> method does not belong to the published interface of the <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.ServicedComponent> class and does not need to be implemented elsewhere.
